title: Fort Davis National Historic Site: Fees & Passes
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Fees & Passes              Fees & Reservations          The Federal Lands Recreation Enhancement Act allows federal land management agencies to utilize recreation fee funds to provide quality recreation experiences through projects to enhance public safety, maintain recreation sites, provide eye-opening educational experiences, build informational wayside exhibits, fund interpretive programs, and offer a wide range of recreational and cultural opportunities. Individual Fees $7.00 - 7 Days Your Fee Dollars at Work.pdf Details Park Entrance fee is $7.00 per person for visitors 16 years and older. Children 15 and under are free. Group Visit Fees There are 3 options: $7.00 per person - 7 Days $15.00 per vehicle - 7 Days $10.00 per motorcycle - 7 Days   Details Fee for commercial groups is $7.00 per person age 16 and over. Educational groups may request a fee waiver in writing on school letterhead prior to visit. Entrance Passes Specific passes for free entrance to the park are honored and are also available at the Visitor Center. These include Senior (Golden Age), Access (Golden Access), Interagency Annual, Interagency Military and Fourth Grade passes.  Click here for more information. Fort Davis NHS Annual Pass You can buy an annual pass to Fort Davis National Historic Site for $30.00. This pass will admit the pass owners and three other adults to the Fort for 12 months from the month of purchase. Special Park Uses & Filming/Photography Permits Commercial filming permits are arranged on an individual basis.
